meanings.definition: In a way that cannot be changed or altered.
meanings.sent1: She believed inalterably in the power of kindness.
meanings.sent2: The rules of mathematics are inalterably true.
meanings.sent3: The cat inalterably refused to eat the new brand of food.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was inalterably etched in his heart.
meanings.sent5: The mountain stood inalterably against the changing sky.

meanings.definition: In a manner that remains constant or unchanging.
meanings.sent1: The old clock inalterably ticked away the seconds.
meanings.sent2: Her loyalty to her friends remained inalterably strong.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn stain on the carpet inalterably resisted all cleaning attempts.
meanings.sent4: The oak tree inalterably stood tall through all seasons.
meanings.sent5: The stars inalterably twinkled in the night sky.
